commit_message:
Minor change in HA test

As replica server seems to sync faster than primary due
to diff in sync intervals, changed the code to check for
replica first instead of waiting for primary to sync.

Change-Id: If8ab4e7c42fea01d77afe47359743f70e94c9f58

[H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None (off by default) Unit

assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over
assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(None, ...), and assertIsNotNone(...)
is preferred over assertNotEqual(None, ...) and assertIsNot(None,
...). Off by default.

More information, see:

Change-Id: If6e1c9738645e5c3caaf52a90cfe8c2ce190082f
'}]
commit_message:
Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None

[H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None (off by default) Unit
test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific
assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over
assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(None, ...), and assertIsNotNone(...)
is preferred over assertNotEqual(None, ...) and assertIsNot(None,
...). Off by default.

More information, see:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises

Change-Id: If6e1c9738645e5c3caaf52a90cfe8c2ce190082f

deleted_lines: self.assertEqual(None, matcher.match(candidate)) self.assertNotEqual(None, mismatch) self.assertNotEqual(None, getattr(mismatch, 'describe', None))

commit_message:
Fix environment unit test

There are cases where the global environment is created and then the
read_global_environment() is called again. This patch fixes the unit
test assertion related to this.

commit_message:
Squash database patches

Remove patches up to the Liberty release to speed up
initial deployment and tests, as we don't support
previous versions anymore.

Closes-bug: #1633975

Change-Id: Icdab0db3f3371cd4eb8a8fb11cbc2328c0a830e7

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import sqlalchemy def upgrade(migrate_engine): meta = sqlalchemy.MetaData(bind=migrate_engine) res_table = sqlalchemy.Table('resource', meta, autoload=True) stack_table = sqlalchemy.Table('stack', meta, autoload=True) root_stack_id = sqlalchemy.Column('root_stack_id', sqlalchemy.String(36)) root_stack_id.create(res_table) root_stack_idx = sqlalchemy.Index('ix_resource_root_stack_id', res_table.c.root_stack_id, mysql_length=36) root_stack_idx.create(migrate_engine) # build stack->owner relationship for all stacks stmt = sqlalchemy.select([stack_table.c.id, stack_table.c.owner_id]) stacks = migrate_engine.execute(stmt) parent_stacks = dict([(s.id, s.owner_id) for s in stacks]) def root_for_stack(stack_id): owner_id = parent_stacks.get(stack_id) if owner_id: return root_for_stack(owner_id) return stack_id # for each stack, update the resources with the root_stack_id for stack_id, owner_id in parent_stacks.items(): root_id = root_for_stack(stack_id) values = {'root_stack_id': root_id} update = res_table.update().where( res_table.c.stack_id == stack_id).values(values) migrate_engine.execute(update)

added_lines: def test_policy_type_list2(self, mock_env): x_env = mock.Mock() x_env.get_policy_types.return_value = [{'foo': 'bar'}] mock_env.return_value = x_env req = orpt.PolicyTypeListRequest() types = self.eng.policy_type_list2(self.ctx, req.obj_to_primitive()) self.assertEqual([{'foo': 'bar'}], types) mock_env.assert_called_once_with() x_env.get_policy_types.assert_called_once_with() @mock.patch.object(environment, 'global_env')

fields support policy-type-list2

added_lines: class TestPolicyTypeList(test_base.SenlinTestCase): def test_policy_type_list_to_primitive(self): sot = policy_type.PolicyTypeListRequest() res = sot.obj_to_primitive() self.assertEqual({}, res['senlin_object.data']) self.assertEqual('PolicyTypeListRequest', res['senlin_object.name']) self.assertEqual('senlin', res['senlin_object.namespace']) self.assertEqual('1.0', res['senlin_object.version'])

commit_message:
Specify 'become' to neccesary tasks (general roles)

Add config_owner_user and config_owner_group to group_vars/all,
which is user and group of Kolla configuration files in /etc/kolla.

Add become to post-deploy playbook.

Add become to only neccesary tasks in roles:
- certificate
- common
- destroy
- mariadb
- memcached
- rabbitmq

Change-Id: I2aba745a6e3928c52642f64551470fd08cbfd058
Partial-Implements: blueprint ansible-specific-task-become

commit_message:
Add option to not update packages during undercloud install

There are cases where a user may not want to update the packages
on the undercloud when doing an undercloud install. For instance,
in the case when using an undercloud image with pre-validated
content. This patch makes that optional, and defaults to doing
the update.

Change-Id: I174d674c1892400bc274d87c5b44fec4dc45f6e8

commit_message:

Previously both were in directories all by themselves

commit_message:
Use 'openstack security group rule create' to replace 'nova secgroup-add-rule'

The command 'nova secgroup-add-rule' is deprecated and will be
removed after Nova 15.0.0 is released, so this patch use
'openstack security group rule create' to replace it for cleanup.

Change-Id: I66f09b4a80b9cf4452d2b7593d1d6635ba5ec8b5
Implements: blueprint use-openstack-command
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/84/394184/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $ openstack security group rule create SECURITY_GROUP_NAME --protocol tcp --dst-port 22:22 --src-ip 0.0.0.0/0 $ openstack security group rule create SECURITY_GROUP_NAME --protocol icmp --dst-port -1:-1 --src-ip 0.0.0.0/0 $ openstack security group rule create SECURITY_GROUP_NAME --protocol udp --dst-port 53:53 --src-ip 0.0.0.0/0
deleted_lines: $ nova secgroup-add-rule SECURITY_GROUP_NAME tcp 22 22 0.0.0.0/0 $ nova secgroup-add-rule SECURITY_GROUP_NAME icmp -1 -1 0.0.0.0/0 $ nova secgroup-add-rule SECURITY_GROUP_NAME udp 53 53 0.0.0.0/0

commit_message:
oslo_db wrap_db_retry defaults changed

Olso DB changed the defaults for wrap_db_retry recently [1]. Previously,
nova would retry 5 times, sleeping zero seconds in between. Because the
defaults changed, it now sleeps 25 seconds for 5 retries.

>>> 1 + 2 + 4 + 8 + 10
25

Change in behaviour aside, it also made the nova unit tests a couple of
minutes slower.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/318135

Change-Id: I8c1b4514c72a93964145e72c2435b59c463dc824

commit_message:
libvirt: Resize an existing disk

The soon to be deleted `Image.cache` method used to skip the
`create_image` call if the disk already existed, and instead just resize
& preallocate. Extract that functionality into `Image.resize`, so that
driver can explicitly do the same in the disk already exists case.

Implements: blueprint libvirt-instance-storage

Change-Id: I9cefa3320245cb6878c97b0340bc6f492350d7de
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/16/332416/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def resize(self, size): """Resize an existing disk.""" virtual_size = self.get_disk_size(self.path) self._resize_disk(size, virtual_size) self._preallocate_disk(size)

subject: libvirt: Add ensure_backing_from_*
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-27 17:47:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/d92909f9fe7b21c83a877ea55623ae4d830484ae', 'message': 'Add check_backing_from_func & check_backing_from_image

Image.cache() currently implicitly does some backing file checks on an
existing disk. check_backing_from_func() and check_backing_from_image()
perform the same function except they do it explicitly.

Note that the only image backend which requires these checks is Qcow2,
as no other backend uses a backing file.

Change-Id: I76ab8aa662b2e2438941e35de2e191db42f59242

commit_message:
libvirt: Add ensure_backing_from_*

Image.cache() currently implicitly does some backing file checks on an
existing disk. ensure_backing_from_func() and
ensure_backing_from_image() perform the same function except they:

* do it explicitly.
* will not create a disk if it doesn't exist.

The latter is a feature for finish_migration which explicitly only
requires backing files to be created.

Note that the only image backend which requires these checks is Qcow2,
as no other backend uses a backing file.

Implements: blueprint libvirt-instance-storage
Co-Authored-By: Diana Clarke <diana.joan.clarke@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I76ab8aa662b2e2438941e35de2e191db42f59242
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/85/322285/26 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def check_backing_from_func(self, func, cache_name, fallback=None): pass def check_backing_from_image(self, context, image_id, fallback=None): pass

Pecan: Find subresource controllers by parent

Fix for finding subresource controller by parent and
added functional tests

Change-Id: I34bb1968fdc3daa75f8a60f5ad9aa68cc3414ad5

subject: Don't query raw_template in stacks uselessly
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-18 19:41:31.000000000', 'files': ['heat/objects/stack.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/c59865870bc8cdd9dbdbaace11b5a0af48f93130', 'message': "Don't query raw_template in stacks uselessly

When partially removing eager loading of raw_template in stacks
(260b79ed28b5dc48f70fe77dfdfc074991ad1e99), we didn't get into account
that accessing the sqlalchemy field would create an additional query
whereas it was previously eager loaded. This removes it by only filling
the field when it's already fetched.

Change-Id: Ifa17c74e3559adaef56593a205101d92e9a37da5
Closes-Bug: #1634127
"}]
commit_message:
Don't query raw_template in stacks uselessly

When partially removing eager loading of raw_template in stacks
(260b79ed28b5dc48f70fe77dfdfc074991ad1e99), we didn't get into account
that accessing the sqlalchemy field would create an additional query
whereas it was previously eager loaded. This removes it by only filling
the field when it's already fetched.

Change-Id: Ifa17c74e3559adaef56593a205101d92e9a37da5
Closes-Bug: #1634127
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/88/388188/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: raw_template_obj = db_stack.__dict__.get('raw_template') if raw_template_obj is not None: # Object is already lazy loaded raw_template_obj = ( raw_template.RawTemplate.from_db_object( context, raw_template.RawTemplate(), raw_template_obj)) stack['raw_template'] = raw_template_obj

commit_message:
Allow for specifying a KOLLA_CONFIG_FILE

Incases where it is useful to place many config.json files
under the same directory (ie one for config_glance_api.json or
one for config_glance_registry.json) we should be able to
specify which file under that directory do we actually want to
use (instead of assuming it is always config.json).

(cherry picked from commit e284d4fbeac8b54c6b69d047167a375605f3eb83)

Change-Id: I107655b3c5b1a4fa45e692850b360b316180d795
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/38/398138/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: config_file = os.environ.get("KOLLA_CONFIG_FILE") if not config_file: config_file = '/var/lib/kolla/config_files/config.json'

commit_message:
Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines[1]:
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more
specific assertions. As a result, assertIsNotNone(...) is preferred
over assertNotEqual(None, ...) and assertIsNot(None, ...)

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises

Change-Id: I4bc4634829560089d933d425b2195139fdadd5cb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/15/398115/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.assertIsNotNone(self.story.volume_id) self.assertIsNotNone(self.story.volume_id) self.assertIsNotNone(None, self.story.device_path)
deleted_lines: self.assertNotEqual(None, self.story.volume_id) self.assertNotEqual(None, self.story.volume_id) self.assertNotEqual(None, self.story.device_path)

commit_message:
Create common code for horizon.instances.js and horizon.firewalls.js

A majority of the previously duplicated code within the above mentioned
files will now reference common-code within horizon.lists.js instead.

Change-Id: Ica397697db33422fb5393c0088d0a695c3c15002
Closes-bug: #1435908

Add NovaServers.boot_servers_and_multiple_attach_volume

This scenario tests multiple volume attaching. We can find
detailed information about it in
doc/feature_request/multiple_attach_volume.rst.

commit_message:
Remove vim header in source files

Trivial fix. Remove vim header in source files.

[H106] Don't put vim configuration in source files (off by default).

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#general

Change-Id: Ic12ef30ae9270e9135bacdacf4d4dcbcc41b3f32

commit_message:
[VPNaaS] Add support for sha2-384 and sha2-512

Commit I87b257ee6500c424fc273955a6d89d972a2823e9 had supported
sha2-384 and sha2-512 in VPNaaS side, this patch add those support
in CLI side.

Change-Id: Ie1842acd830e9b8c624cf099491ed5ff46304b8d
Closes-Bug: #1639990

commit_message:
Add option to reindex notification-less plugins

Add an option --notification-less to 'searchlight-manage index sync' to
re-sync only plugins that don't have notifications.

Implement blueprint: reindex-interval

Change-Id: I6295dc6b00a21ca0064b92d0515c682ba1f17708
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/searchlight refs/changes/09/398009/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: To reindex resources only without notification:: $ searchlight-manage index sync --notification-less .. note:: We *strongly* recommend putting the notification-less plugins in their own resource group and scheduling a `cron https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cron`_ job to periodically re-sync the notification plugins to keep the documents up to date.

subject: Add __ne__ built-in function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-17 01:18:42.000000000', 'files': ['solumclient/openstack/common/apiclient/fake_client.py', 'solumclient/openstack/common/apiclient/base.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-solumclient/commit/52d41fc859d73e32c4c861da63cac7786bba95dc', 'message': 'Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining __eq__(),
one should also define __ne__() so that the operators will behave as
expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: I837e65c37d434b0f8b01a16858394475615bd2ff
'}]
commit_message:
Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining __eq__(),
one should also define __ne__() so that the operators will behave as
expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: I837e65c37d434b0f8b01a16858394475615bd2ff
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-solumclient refs/changes/10/387110/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def __ne__(self, other): return not self.__eq__(other)

commit_message:
Add basic tests for OSC plugin baremetal node commands

Add testcases for commands:
openstack baremetal node create,
openstack baremetal node delete,
openstack baremetal node list,
openstack baremetal node show,
openstack baremetal node set,
openstack baremetal node unset.

Change-Id: I32d9e33a868f2224d179f3d16de19f62b85d535e
Partial-Bug: #1566329
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ironicclient refs/changes/87/301687/37 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2016 Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import uuid from functional.common import exceptions from functional.common import test class BaremetalTests(test.TestCase): """Functional tests for baremetal commands.""" NAME = 'a' + uuid.uuid4().hex UUID = uuid.uuid4() DRIVER = "fake" def setUp(self): super(BaremetalTests, self).setUp() raw_output = self.openstack('baremetal create' + ' --driver {0}'.format(self.DRIVER) + ' --name {0}'.format(self.NAME) + ' --uuid {0}'.format(self.UUID)) expected = self.NAME self.assertIn(expected, raw_output) def tearDown(self): super(BaremetalTests, self).tearDown() try: raw_output = self.openstack('baremetal delete ' + self.NAME) self.assertOutput('', raw_output) except exceptions.CommandFailed: pass def test_baremetal_create(self): """Check baremetal create command.""" raw_output = self.openstack('baremetal create' + ' --driver {0}'.format(self.DRIVER), ' --name {0}'.format(self.NAME)) items = self.parse_listing(raw_output) self.assert_table_structure(items, ['Field', 'Value']) expected = self.NAME self.assertIn(expected, raw_output) def test_baremetal_delete(self): """Check baremetal delete command.""" raw_output = self.openstack('baremetal delete ' + self.NAME) self.assertOutput('', raw_output) def test_baremetal_list(self): """Check baremetal command.""" raw_output = self.openstack('baremetal list') items = self.parse_listing(raw_output) self.assert_table_structure(items, ['UUID', 'Name', 'Instance UUID', 'Power State', 'Provisioning State', 'Maintenance']) expected = self.NAME self.assertIn(expected, raw_output) def test_baremetal_set(self): """Check baremetal set command.""" property = "driver" prop_value = "agent_ssh " raw_output = self.openstack('baremetal set --property {0}={1}' .format(property, prop_value) + self.NAME) self.assertOutput('', raw_output) raw_output = self.openstack('baremetal show ' + self.NAME) self.assertIn(prop_value, raw_output) def test_baremetal_show(self): """Check baremetal show command.""" raw_output = self.openstack('baremetal show ' + self.NAME) items = self.parse_listing(raw_output) self.assert_table_structure(items, ['Field', 'Value']) self.assertIn(self.NAME, raw_output) def test_baremetal_unset(self): """Check baremetal unset command.""" property = "name " raw_output = self.openstack('baremetal unset --property ' + property + self.NAME) self.assertOutput('', raw_output) raw_output = self.openstack('baremetal show ' + str(self.UUID)) self.assertNotIn(self.NAME, raw_output)

commit_message:
Add sha384 and sha512 auth algorithms for vendor drivers

Currently, VPNaaS limits the IPSec and IKE auth algorithm to
"sha1" and "sha256". If user add a new driver(eg, Hardware VPN Gateway),
and the new driver supports more auth algorithms, such as "sha2-384",
"sha2-512", it can not integrated with current VPNaaS plugin.

This patch add "sha384" and "sha512" auth algorithms in API and DB side,
Because of Openswan, Strongswan, Libreswan and Cisco CSR driver doesn't
support these, so we add a validator in ipsec and Cisco CSR service driver,
that will raise an exception when creating or updating the IPSec/IKE Policy
auth algorithm with "sha384" and "sha512".
Other vendors can bypass validate ike_policy and ipsec_policy
when creating and updating auth_algorithm, or implement specific
logic for themselves.

DocImpact
APIImpact
NOTE: CLI support also needs change.

Closes-Bug: #1638152
Change-Id: I87b257ee6500c424fc273955a6d89d972a2823e9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas refs/changes/02/393702/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
devstack: Quit reading fwaas_driver.ini when fwaas is enabled

fwaas_driver.ini is no longer created when fwaas is enabled. [1]
The file shouldn't be read to avoid failing to launch neutron-vpnaas.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/350362/

Change-Id: I2147cfd405ced1dde2b3abb6b430ff032466274c
Closes-Bug: #1617154

commit_message:
IPsec traffic metering for VPNaaS

This blueprint covers the support of IPsec traffic metering for VPNaaS by
adding metering function to the VPN agent. This VPNaaS metering feature would
support VPN service for various architectures such as VPN with l3-agent or VPN
with OVN solution.

Related-bug: #1591993
Co-Authored-By: Grace <huangyur@us.ibm.com>
Co-Authored-By: Bepsy <paulbe@us.ibm.com>
Co-Authored-By: MingShuangXian <xianms@cn.ibm.com>

Change-Id: Iede9139c4f393bd24773d0001a81a63415bb850f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs refs/changes/51/346051/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ================================= IPsec traffic metering for VPNaaS ================================= This blueprint covers the support of IPsec traffic metering for VPNaaS by adding metering function to the VPN agent. This VPNaaS metering feature would support VPN service for various architectures such as VPN with l3-agent or VPN with OVN solution. Problem Description =================== Currently, there is no support to measure the IPSec traffic for VPNaaS in both l3 router and openstack architectures. However, the traffic traversing the IPSec tunnel need to be measured for billing and monitoring purpose for VPNaaS. In current l3 router solution, for the purpose of metering on IPSec traffic, VPN service needs to be enhanced to manage IPSec connection mapping with the neutron bandwidth metering. On the other hand, the neutron l3-metering is to meter at l3 router levels which is not applicable for OVN any more. Thus, a generic approach is proposed in this blueprint to add IPSec metering functionality in VPN agent to support various openstack architectures with VPNaaS as described in next section. Proposed Change =============== Add IPsec traffic metering functionality to VPN agent. The VPN-metering will manage the metering chain/rules for each VPN connections which provides the connection and resource mapping for ceilometer. VPN-metering will do a periodical data collection and send notification to ceilometer. This VPN specific metering of VPN agent would be a function in parallel with normal neutron metering for other service. The proposed VPN-metering function should be able to support various openstack architectures with VPNaaS. Changes on VPN agent for Metering ================================= Block diagram of vpn agent:: +-----------------+ +-----------------+ | | | | | VPN Agent | | VPN Agent | | (metering) +---+ HA +---+ (metering) | | | | | +-----------------+ +-----------------+ | | | | | | + + RPC Notification RPC Notification + + | | | | | | +-----------------------------------------------+ | | | Ceilometer | | | +-----------------------------------------------+ Data Model Impact ----------------- None since we can use the connection id as the chain id and define different meter name in ceilometer for in/out counters, then there won't need any Data Model changes any more. Work Items 1. Manage iptables chains/rules. 2. Get traffic counters based on chains/rules. Clear counters after reading. 3. Send Notification to ceilometer. 4. Backwards compatibility with neutron metering when disable VPN-metering. 5. verification on co-exist with normal neutron metering support. Features deferred to future work -------------------------------- References ========== rfe: https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1591993

commit_message:
Modification to improve error/help message for extensions

Neutron CLIs return "404 Not Found" error message when they
cannot work on a extension( like VPNaaS, FWaaS etc) or when they
are not able to determine the information.
However "404 Not found" error message is not correct and not
descriptive enough for the end user to work upon. This fix tries
to improve on the same message.
Also, if extensions are not enabled, then help for the same should
not be displayed. This patch also attempts to fix this issue.

Change-Id: I89a271880c291fa13bff95a8f8fc4e1d6b7ae415
Closes-Bug: #1496748
Closes-Bug: #1094713

commit_message:
Fix doc build if git is absent

When building packages if git is absent, then we should not set
html_last_updated_fmt. It can still be set via the -D switch
when building with sphinx-build.

Closes-Bug: #1552251
Change-Id: I9465e116e52517fecc651ef01d8e3fc7b78b7e48
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib refs/changes/34/390134/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import warnings "-n1"] try: html_last_updated_fmt = subprocess.Popen( git_cmd, stdout=subprocess.PIPE).communicate()[0] except Exception: warnings.warn('Cannot get last updated time from git repository. ' 'Not setting "html_last_updated_fmt".')

subject: Fix RPC Versioning
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-03 16:53:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/6db61b3e7fd15ee8b735746f0bb095cd080137fe', 'message': "Support independent versioning of RPC API's

There are three RPC channels within Trove, the one between the API
service and the taskmanager, between the taskmanager and the
guestagent, and between the guestagent and the conductor.

During the migration ot oslo.messaging, all three were pinned to a
single version. This change decouples them and makes it possible to
version all three of them independently.

In this proposed implementation, any new API call will be required to
bump the version. At each release, we should update the dictionary in
trove/common/rpc/version.py to reflect the versions of each of the
API's.

We will also need to come up with guidelines on how and when to update
the version(s).

Change-Id: I2b9d50e15ac98041c427b74cac63ac231cb4b53e
Co-Authored-By: Morgan Jones <morgan@parelastic.com>
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-06 20:38:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/2600243e698ea2e7e353f1df5c5e2ee368375e70', 'message': 'Fix RPC Versioning

commit_message:

Modifies how the APIs for Conductor, Guest, and Taskmanager
handle versioning for olso_messaging.

commit_message:
Add insecure option in functional tests for SSL endpoints

This patch fixes the issue when functional tests are run
against a deployment that has https based endpoints.
The insecure option is not being passed when initiating
magnumclient or keystoneclient as a result we get SSL
error.

Change-Id: I35525917b96b64e57c984924c72b3c696949f67f
Closes-Bug: #1640341

subject: Stop dhclient in os-net-config if interface not set for DHCP
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-11 00:25:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-net-config/commit/9e19841271e2965b3de9d4dac5daa4d2c4db95ea', 'message': "Stop dhclient in os-net-config if interface is not configured for DHCP

As described in https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1640598,
there are situations in which the dhclient instance started by
dhcp-all-interfaces runs even after the interface is no longer
configured for DHCP.  This change will terminate the instance
using the '-r' argument if 'BOOTPROTO' is not set to 'dhcp' in
the ifcfg file for the interface.  The dhclient will only be
stopped if a dhclient pid file exists, the pid file will be
removed after stopping dhclient.

commit_message:
Stop dhclient in os-net-config if interface not set for DHCP

As described in https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1640598,
there are situations in which the dhclient instance started by
dhcp-all-interfaces runs even after the interface is no longer
configured for DHCP.  This change will terminate the instance
using the '-r' argument if 'BOOTPROTO' is not set to 'dhcp' in
the ifcfg file for the interface.  The dhclient will only be
stopped if a dhclient pid file exists, the pid file will be
removed after stopping dhclient.

Co-Authored-By: Dan Sneddon <dsneddon@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I8a52ef5fb8052f185c01dcc27a1ecd70f5d630c8
Closes-Bug: 1640598
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-net-config refs/changes/46/396446/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import os stop_dhclient_interfaces = [] if ("BOOTPROTO=static" in iface_data) or ("BOOTPROTO=none" in iface_data): stop_dhclient_interfaces.append(interface_name) # if dhclient is running and static address set, stop dhclient for interface in stop_dhclient_interfaces: pid_file = '/var/run/dhclient-%s.pid' % (interface) if os.path.exists(pid_file): msg = 'Stopping dhclient on interface %s' % interface self.execute(msg, '/usr/sbin/dhclient', '-r', '-pf', pid_file, interface) try: os.unlink(pid_file) except OSError: pass

subject: Avoid UnboundLocalErrors in _create_bulk_ml2
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-07 22:45:09.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/b97d008854188c4f8b89c280b61b5cf703f1f27a', 'message': 'Avoid UnboundLocalErrors in _create_bulk_ml2

The exception handler blocks in _create_bulk_ml2 assumed
some local variables from iterations would be present.
This led to masking errors caused by failures in starting
the session or fetching the method with getattr because
the local variable reference would result in an
UnboundLocalError exception.

This patch just narrows the exception handlers to the
iterations.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I74908817049826d1329a3e50cccc4c2c5708b621
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid UnboundLocalErrors in _create_bulk_ml2

The exception handler blocks in _create_bulk_ml2 assumed
some local variables from iterations would be present.
This led to masking errors caused by failures in starting
the session or fetching the method with getattr because
the local variable reference would result in an
UnboundLocalError exception.

This patch just narrows the exception handlers to the
iterations.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I74908817049826d1329a3e50cccc4c2c5708b621

V3 "Change User Password" example to be more clear about which field
the "new" password should be in and that the user's password will be
that "new" password.

commit_message:
Remove duplicated 'User-Agent' header from object-updater's requests

When Object-Server saves async-update in pickle files,
'User-Agent: object-server %(pid)' (the key is title style) is included
in the pickles. However, Object-Updater will add
'user-agent: object-updater %(pid)' (the key is lower case style) to the
pickled headers and use it to make http connection. According to RFC
7230, each header field consists of a case-insensitive field name,
therefore either of 'User-Agent' and 'user-agent' should not be included
in the headers.

This patch removes old 'User-Agent' header from object-updater's
requests.

Change-Id: Ia624558395584457c718b311fe80e1a8406e22ad
Closes-Bug:#1635114
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/99/388999/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: actual_headers.pop('User-Agent').startswith('object-updater')) del expected_post_headers['User-Agent']

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-15 13:48:53.000000000', 'files': ['diskimage-create/diskimage-create.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/cb4be77c4bd3dfbb69f4a2f05c73730bda894c50', 'message': "Enable EPEL repository for CentOS amphorae

Closes-Bug: #1640827

commit_message:
Enable EPEL repository for CentOS amphorae

This is needed to install the package 'jq'

Not needed for other Red Hat variants:
* Fedora has jq in its main repo
*  RHEL has it in OpenStack repos (required to build a RHEL amphora)

Change-Id: I5c1c911c28215410b7f4c984bee8a69f0bee43eb
Closes-Bug: #1640827
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/51/397751/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: diskimage-create check for qemu-kvm-ev/qemu-img-ev for CentOS
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-15 11:06:44.000000000', 'files': ['diskimage-create/diskimage-create.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/88ceb68d2c00938d6d1c9071d8ed73749b642c34', 'message': 'diskimage-create check for qemu-kvm-ev/qemu-img-ev for CentOS

Checking packages using "yum list installed qemu-kvm/qemu-img" fails for
Centos,while qemu-kvm-ev and qemu-img-ev are installed using
"RDO CentOS-7 - QEMU EV".

This repository is added by devstack.

I changed the shell script to check [qemu-kvm qemu-img] and [kpartx git]
separately and when [qemu-kvm qemu-img] are not found, check for
qemu-kvm-ev or qemu-img-ev instead of exiting.

Change-Id: I5bd929e5aba76319cc86e0fc97825929e32629c2
Close-Bug: #1637435
'}]
commit_message:
diskimage-create check for qemu-kvm-ev/qemu-img-ev for CentOS

Checking packages using "yum list installed qemu-kvm/qemu-img" fails for
Centos,while qemu-kvm-ev and qemu-img-ev are installed using
"RDO CentOS-7 - QEMU EV".

This repository is added by devstack.

I changed the shell script to check [qemu-kvm qemu-img] and [kpartx git]
separately and when [qemu-kvm qemu-img] are not found, check for
qemu-kvm-ev or qemu-img-ev instead of exiting.

Change-Id: I5bd929e5aba76319cc86e0fc97825929e32629c2
Close-Bug: #1637435
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/86/397686/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: PKG_LIST="qemu-kvm qemu-img" for pkg in $PKG_LIST; do if ! yum list installed $pkg &> /dev/null; then if ! yum list installed $pkg"-ev" &> /dev/null; then echo "Required package " $pkg " or " $pkg"-ev" " is not installed. Exiting." exit 1 fi fi done PKG_LIST="kpartx git"

subject: Modify variable's using method in Log Messages
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-07 01:59:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/f7cae8df0d0f64e5d7c723c35469d74bc2687538', 'message': "Modify variable's using method in Log Messages

String interpolation should be delayed to be handled by the logging code, 
rather than being done at the point of the logging call. 
Ref:http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#log-translation
For example:
# WRONG
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s') % variable)
# RIGHT
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s'), variable)

Change-Id: I77c9b9783c623167ada1631cf05bf4cf4c40e6b1
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-07 02:00:46.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/cmd/house_keeping.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/4ced93b005ffed44c7f759322759a249f94db4fe', 'message': "Modify variable's using method in Log Messages

rather than being done at the point of the logging call.

For example:
# WRONG
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s') % variable)
# RIGHT

Change-Id: I77c9b9783c623167ada1631cf05bf4cf4c40e6b1

commit_message:
Modify variable's using method in Log Messages

String interpolation should be delayed to be handled by the logging code, 
rather than being done at the point of the logging call. 
Ref:http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#log-translation
For example:
# WRONG
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s') % variable)
# RIGHT
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s'), variable)

Change-Id: I77c9b9783c623167ada1631cf05bf4cf4c40e6b1

subject: Wrong result is returned when call events getting API
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-24 06:31:16.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/unit/api/v2/test_query.py', 'ceilometer/api/controllers/v2/events.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer/commit/2cc187740386024b8e458b4727559bddecee59ca', 'message': "Wrong result is returned when call events getting API

For current implementation, events getting API only support 'eq' query
operation when query field is the one of 'event_type', 'message_id',
'start_timestamp' and 'end_timestamp'. But there is a problem, if the
query operation wasn't specified as 'eq'(e.g. 'ne'), the returned result
is still the same as the query operation was specified as 'eq'.

This patch add a check for this situation: if the query field is the one
of 'event_type', 'message_id', 'start_timestamp', 'end_timestamp', and
the query operation user specified is not 'eq', then a client side error
will be thrown.

Also, corresponding unit test case is added.

Change-Id: I4e4b127045de6e933281d9289271af891c3c80fe
Closes-Bug: #1558594
(cherry picked from commit ac3ff88c03ea3685d7f3511bbae16785646e56ba)
"}]
commit_message:
Wrong result is returned when call events getting API

For current implementation, events getting API only support 'eq' query
operation when query field is the one of 'event_type', 'message_id',
'start_timestamp' and 'end_timestamp'. But there is a problem, if the
query operation wasn't specified as 'eq'(e.g. 'ne'), the returned result
is still the same as the query operation was specified as 'eq'.

This patch add a check for this situation: if the query field is the one
of 'event_type', 'message_id', 'start_timestamp', 'end_timestamp', and
the query operation user specified is not 'eq', then a client side error
will be thrown.

Also, corresponding unit test case is added.

Change-Id: I4e4b127045de6e933281d9289271af891c3c80fe
Closes-Bug: #1558594
(cherry picked from commit ac3ff88c03ea3685d7f3511bbae16785646e56ba)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/07/296907/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if i.op != 'eq': error = (_('operator %(operator)s is not supported. Only' ' equality operator is available for field' ' %(field)s') % {'operator': i.op, 'field': i.field}) raise base.ClientSideError(error)

commit_message:
Use oooq to install the undercloud

This patch shows what it might look like to have tripleo.sh consume
tripleo-quickstart for some functionality. It adds a new --oooq option
that will use tripleo-quickstart for the undercloud install.

Change-Id: I4941e922a388eae205a73769355f7860f2ba9efe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/30/348530/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo " --oooq -- Use tripleo-quickstart where possible." -l,help,repo-setup,delorean-setup,delorean-build,multinode-setup,undercloud,overcloud-images,register-nodes,introspect-nodes,overcloud-deploy,overcloud-update,overcloud-delete,use-containers,overcloud-pingtest,skip-pingtest-cleanup,oooq,all,enable-check,run-tempest \ # OOOQ VARS OOOQ=${OOOQ:-""} OPT_TAGS=${OPT_TAGS:-""} OPT_WORKDIR=${OPT_WORKDIR:-"$TRIPLEO_ROOT/quickstart"} OPT_TEARDOWN=${OPT_TEARDOWN:-"none"} mkdir -p $TRIPLEO_ROOT --oooq) OOOQ="1"; shift 1;; if [ "$OOOQ" = "1" ]; then log "Using tripleo-quickstart for undercloud install" return fi function oooq { log "OOOQ" clone openstack/tripleo-quickstart if ! grep -q 127.0.0.2 /etc/hosts; then sudo /bin/bash -c \ 'echo "127.0.0.2 localhost.localdomain" >> /etc/hosts' fi if [ ! -f $OPT_WORKDIR/hosts ]; then echo "[virthost]" > $OPT_WORKDIR/hosts echo "127.0.0.2" >> $OPT_WORKDIR/hosts echo >> $OPT_WORKDIR/hosts echo "[undercloud]" >> $OPT_WORKDIR/hosts echo "127.0.0.2" >> $OPT_WORKDIR/hosts fi # quickstart assumes packages are already installed because it uses # prebuilt images. sudo yum install -y python-tripleoclient $TRIPLEO_ROOT/tripleo-quickstart/quickstart.sh \ --install-deps $TRIPLEO_ROOT/tripleo-quickstart/quickstart.sh \ --retain-inventory \ --working-dir $OPT_WORKDIR \ -t $OPT_TAGS \ -T $OPT_TEARDOWN \ 127.0.0.2 log "OOOQ - DONE" } OPT_TAGS="$OPT_TAGS,undercloud-scripts,undercloud-install"# Must come last so that $OPT_TAGS is set correctly if [ "$OOOQ" = 1 ]; then oooq fi

commit_message:
Use undercloud-virt-setup tag for Ironic pxe_ssh configuration

This task is not always needed unless the tripleo-quickstart virt setup
was also used. Tag it with a new tag, undercloud-virt-setup so that it
can be disabled if desired. Add the new tag to the default tags used in
quickstart.sh.

The delegate_to functionality is also not needed, so that is cleaned up
as well.

Change-Id: I4aaa0eb1e666c2756134536519f326283625d81b

commit_message:
DNM: DVR: debug multinode job failure

Sometimes seeing "RTNETLINK answers: Network is unreachable"
trying to add default route in DHCP namespace.  This is
happening because we have not added any IP to the tap
interface.  Trying to debug why we didn't...

Change-Id: Ia6020e2eb7f00987fdf8aa2ed062073d9251cbeb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/14/356714/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if not ip_cidrs: # get all fixed_ips here for debugging pip_cidrs = [] for fixed_ip in port.fixed_ips: subnet = fixed_ip.subnet net = netaddr.IPNetwork(subnet.cidr) ip_cidr = '%s/%s' % (fixed_ip.ip_address, net.prefixlen) pip_cidrs.append(ip_cidr) LOG.exception(_LE('No IP addresses on DHCP port for ' 'network %(id)s. All fixed_ips: %(cidrs)s'), {'id': network.id, 'cidrs': ','.join(pip_cidrs)})

commit_message:
Make service_checks easier to run independently of kolla-ansible

Set a default for CONFIG_DIR in service_checks to more easily allow
consumers not using the kolla-ansible tool to run the prechecks.

Change-Id: I78bc5dd6f37e6a60ecc6a86d43e56b05803a4fd5
Closes-Bug: #1629893

commit_message:
Move manila-share service to network node

After a research regarding manila-share node,
is required that for the generic driver the
manila-share service should be run on the network node.

As the generic driver is our default driver, so this change is needed.

Closes-Bug: #1639028
Change-Id: I4b73fec4f96e3e2f9c442c8716941bede5dfbc8e
(cherry picked from commit a2707ecf0043d5df25d0f87d6dde55aeb52260da)

commit_message:
Revert "Disable devstack plugin for builder 'ironic-grenade'"

This reverts commit d6a054376d2956a15b79a40e530bcbf67a7dda65.

This commit caused bug 1642362, by changing when extra-vars were
read, which in some cases caused the ironic-inspector devstack plugin
to be enabled in local.conf before the ironic plugin, causing failures.

Change-Id: I9a19d7ddaa982b692b4fd678e823f742bfa4bd03
Closes-bug: #1642362

added_lines: # devstack plugin didn't exist until mitaka if [[ "$ZUUL_BRANCH" != "stable/liberty" ]] ; then export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'\n'"enable_plugin ironic git://git.openstack.org/openstack/ironic" fi
deleted_lines: # NOTE(jlvillal): export not needed for this as used within devstack-virtual-ironic # We disable the devstack plugin because the grenade code in Ironic # enables it and enabling it twice causes errors. IRONIC_DISABLE_DEVSTACK_PLUGIN=1 # devstack plugin didn't exist until mitaka if [[ -z "$IRONIC_DISABLE_DEVSTACK_PLUGIN" && "$ZUUL_BRANCH" != "stable/liberty" ]] ; then export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'\n'"enable_plugin ironic git://git.openstack.org/openstack/ironic" fi

commit_message:
Add tox_install.sh for pypowervm upper-constraints workaround

With the recent addition of pypowervm to upper-constraints, installs
of networking-powervm are now by default enforcing the version set there.
Since the master branch of networking-powervm depends on the develop
version of pypowervm, this causes installs to fail.

This changeset adds a wrapper script (tox_install.sh) that edits
the upper-constraints file and replaces the pypowervm version pin
then sets pypowervm to be installed from source instead.

Change-Id: Ibd7052a62f7dfb85e6e18a5e1c4073bf43b88af4

commit_message:
Add tox_install.sh for pypowervm upper-constraints workaround

With the recent addition of pypowervm to upper-constraints, installs
of ceilometer-powervm are now by default enforcing the version set there.
Since the master branch of ceilometer-powervm depends on the develop
version of pypowervm, this causes installs to fail.

This changeset adds a wrapper script (tox_install.sh) that edits
the upper-constraints file and replaces the pypowervm version pin
then sets pypowervm to be installed from source instead.

Change-Id: Ib60ee84ecb168991439ac5d097ba07a62d2329a7

commit_message:
Add the slaac ipv6 address mode without ra mode

SLAAC can be used without the ipv6_ra_mode being set and an external router will
be used for routing.

Change-Id: Ic49ab978cff92d52dddbbe37d4c7ef0f7ca51bd3
Closes-bug: #1632884
(cherry picked from commit f047962e7572f40116afb834b35d976a0fdc434e)

added_lines: Message is sent through a queue and exists until it is deleted by a recipient or automatically by the system based on a TTL (time-to-live) value. All message-related operations require Client-Id to be included in the headers. This is to ensure that messages are not echoed back to the client that posted them unless the client explicitly requests this.

commit_message:
Add tox_install.sh for pypowervm upper-constraints workaround

With the recent addition of pypowervm to upper-constraints, installs
of nova-powervm are now by default enforcing the version set there.
Since the master branch of nova-powervm depends on the develop
version of pypowervm, this causes installs to fail.

This changeset adds a wrapper script (tox_install.sh) that edits
the upper-constraints file and replaces the pypowervm version pin
then sets pypowervm to be installed from source instead.

Change-Id: Id8e117bc6a7b1b224a9e86e9b29821627adb51db
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm refs/changes/13/398513/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: install_command = {toxinidir}/tools/tox_install.sh {env:UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE:https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/plain/upper-constraints.txt} {opts} {packages}

commit_message:
Replaces uuid.uuid4 with uuidutils.generate_uuid()

Openstack common has a wrapper for generating uuids.
We should only use that function when generating uuids for consistency.

Change-Id: Ie68850e529eee51c66e8d29a9025e1390576bc1a
Closes-bug: #1082248

commit_message:
neutron: restore votes for rally job

Ia842991bdeb17592a2a2cf91f2a7cbd7893a7ddf mistakenly removed a line that
effectively made the rally job back to non-voting (plus making some
other unrelated job voting). This patch restores sanity.

Change-Id: I50c7cf6a28f617b9eeb0319305a07fe601bd14c6

commit_message:
Remove setting of OS_IMAGE_API_VERSION for newton and above

We do this already in instack-undercloud, and it should be supported
by image create already.

Change-Id: I3bfae155d4e7594d8212e91fa92c7b8860cb925c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/21/387421/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ "${STABLE_RELEASE}" =~ ^(liberty|mitaka)$ ]] ; then export OS_IMAGE_API_VERSION=1 fi
deleted_lines: # TODO: remove this when Image create in openstackclient supports the v2 API export OS_IMAGE_API_VERSION=1

subject: Restrict branches that nova-net grenade jobs run on
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-16 17:58:49.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/f078294a8e4c2d7fe51e08b2fc85f4c4fdc69eef', 'message': "Restrict branches that nova-net grenade jobs run on

Change I33e8c81bb5366d2d1feccc144baa54ed3ed51e33 made the
gate-grenade-dsvm-{node}, gate-grenade-dsvm-forward and
gate-grenade-dsvm-multinode jobs run specifically with
nova-network.

Change I62348f39b58e188b85d18918cfd302fa2d006907 attempted
to restrict those nova-net grenade jobs to only run on
branches <= Newton because in master (ocata) nova is going
to make nova-network not run unless cells v1 is configured:

I7309afa5230bcaeeeddb554d95c327d3a614ae6e

However, that restriction was failing because of a later
definition to not run any gate-grenade-dsvm* jobs on
stable/liberty, which effectively meant that those nova-net
grenade jobs would run on master since master != stable/liberty.

This change makes the nova-net grenade job branch restrictions
more obvious, and also moves the global 'don't run grenade on the
oldest branch' rule before the more specific filters as the last
match wins, so we want to do generic filters first and specific
filters after that.

Change-Id: I47f72eac6a7657bf44319fa5d2df18ce62827f6f
"}]
commit_message:
Restrict branches that nova-net grenade jobs run on

Change I33e8c81bb5366d2d1feccc144baa54ed3ed51e33 made the
gate-grenade-dsvm-{node}, gate-grenade-dsvm-forward and
gate-grenade-dsvm-multinode jobs run specifically with
nova-network.

Change I62348f39b58e188b85d18918cfd302fa2d006907 attempted
to restrict those nova-net grenade jobs to only run on
branches <= Newton because in master (ocata) nova is going
to make nova-network not run unless cells v1 is configured:

I7309afa5230bcaeeeddb554d95c327d3a614ae6e

However, that restriction was failing because of a later
definition to not run any gate-grenade-dsvm* jobs on
stable/liberty, which effectively meant that those nova-net
grenade jobs would run on master since master != stable/liberty.

This change makes the nova-net grenade job branch restrictions
more obvious, and also moves the global 'don't run grenade on the
oldest branch' rule before the more specific filters as the last
match wins, so we want to do generic filters first and specific
filters after that.

Change-Id: I47f72eac6a7657bf44319fa5d2df18ce62827f6f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/17/398517/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # don't run any grenade jobs on the oldest supported stable # branch, this lets us catch all jobs that don't otherwise have # additional modifications. # NOTE(mriedem): This must be defined before any more specific grenade # job filters so that those can override the branch filter if necessary. - name: ^gate-grenade-dsvm branch: ^(?!stable/liberty).*$ # NOTE(mriedem): This job uses xenial nodes which restricts it to >= newton # changes. It also uses nova-network which is deprecated and not the default # in Ocata so we need to just restrict it to running on stable/newton # changes. - name: gate-grenade-dsvm-ubuntu-xenial branch: stable/newton # NOTE(mriedem): These jobs use nova-network specifically which won't work # after newton so restrict them to just run on mitaka and newton changes. - name: ^gate-grenade-dsvm-(forward|multinode).*$ branch: ^stable/(?:mitaka|newton)$
deleted_lines: # NOTE(mriedem): nova-network will only work in cells v1 configurations # starting in Ocata, so all nova-network backed grenade jobs have to be # restricted to <= Newton. - name: ^gate-grenade-dsvm(?!-neutron).* branch: ^stable/(liberty|mitaka|newton)$ # don't run any grenade jobs on the oldest supported stable # branch, this lets us catch all jobs that don't otherwise have # additional modifications. - name: ^gate-grenade-dsvm branch: ^(?!stable/liberty).*$

added_lines: # Copyright 2016 Intel Corporation. # Copyright 2016 Isaku Yamahata <isaku.yamahata at intel com> # <isaku.yamahata at gmail com> # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_config import cfg from neutron.db.migration import cli as migration from neutron.tests.functional.db import test_migrations from neutron.tests.unit import testlib_api from networking_sfc.db.migration.models import head VERSION_TABLE = 'alembic_version_sfc' class _TestModelsMigrationsODL(test_migrations._TestModelsMigrations): def db_sync(self, engine): cfg.CONF.set_override('connection', engine.url, group='database') for conf in migration.get_alembic_configs(): self.alembic_config = conf self.alembic_config.neutron_config = cfg.CONF migration.do_alembic_command(conf, 'upgrade', 'heads') def get_metadata(self): return head.get_metadata() def include_object(self, object_, name, type_, reflected, compare_to): if type_ == 'table' and (name.startswith('alembic') or name == VERSION_TABLE): return False if type_ == 'index' and reflected and name.startswith("idx_autoinc_"): return False return True class TestModelsMigrationsMysql(testlib_api.MySQLTestCaseMixin, _TestModelsMigrationsODL, testlib_api.SqlTestCaseLight): pass class TestModelsMigrationsPostgresql(testlib_api.PostgreSQLTestCaseMixin, _TestModelsMigrationsODL, testlib_api.SqlTestCaseLight): pass

commit_message:
change networking-sfc python test job from python-db-job to python-job

  - The change is to make networking-sfc unittests name the same as other
    projects. Currently our unittest job name is like
    networking-sfc-python27-db-jobs, others like neutron-python27-jobs.
    It may make code reviewers confuse that we only cover db unittests.

Change-Id: I0b8c92486553aae6e8165fbbf3c8ec342b19b16a

commit_message:
Force gate-{name}-pep8-{node} to build needed wheels

In an effort to make our bindep dependencies better, we want to
have the pep8 jobs not use our wheel mirrors.  This ensures that
projects are able to be build properly if our wheel mirror is down or
a new python dependency is released by has not been build by our
wheel-build job.

This has a high chance of breaking existing jobs that are depending on
openstack-infra wheel mirrors.

Change-Id: I0880b96cdca024965d92e120389eb25939436daa
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/75/391875/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # We force the removal of our wheel mirrors from pip.conf to ensure we can # build the required wheels if needed. This helps to ensure that # bindep.txt is up-to-date. - shell: | #!/bin/bash -xe # Write global pip configuration minus wheel mirror. awk '!/extra-index-url/' /etc/pip.conf > /tmp/pip.conf sudo mv /tmp/pip.conf /etc/ sudo chown root:root /etc/pip.conf sudo chmod 0644 /etc/pip.conf

commit_message:
Add microversion cap information

Currently we only publish the master branch of api-ref to:
http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute
and we have microversion caps for different releases.
It will be better for user to understand if we add
also microversion caps information to the doc.

Change-Id: Ic6c042f68f5d340a68abad6701e65d44e46da3a7
Closes-bug: #1640995

commit_message:
Docs: Document using operators with root device hints

This patch is adding documentation for operators in root device hints:
In which release they are available, what are the supported operators
and few usage examples.

The patch also adds a link to the documentation in the release note.

Closes-Bug: #1561137
Change-Id: I419ca5b07238a3996bcc0c76560349ad70a93f52
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/14/386714/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: From the Ocataca release on, the hints can have an operator at the beginning of the value string. If no operator is specified the default operator assumed is ``==`` (for numerical values) and ``s==`` (for string values). Currently the supported operators are:: * = (equal to or greater than as a number) * == (equal to as a number) * != (not equal to as a number) * >= (greater than or equal to as a number) * > (greater than as a number) * <= (less than or equal to as a number) * < (less than as a number) * s== (equal to as a string) * s!= (not equal to as a string) * s>= (greater than or equal to as a string) * s> (greater than as a string) * s<= (less than or equal to as a string) * s< (less than as a string) * <in> (substring) * <all-in> (all elements contained in collection) * <or> (find one of these) Examples are: * Finding a disk larger or equal to 60 GiB and non-rotational (SSD):: ironic node-update <node-uuid> add properties/root_device='{"size": ">= 60", "rotational": false}' * Finding a disk which vendor is ``samsung`` or ``winsys``:: ironic node-update <node-uuid> add properties/root_device='{"vendor": "<or> samsung <or> winsys"}'

commit_message:
Hyper-V PCI Passthrough spec

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/hyper-v-pci-passthrough

Discrete Device Assignment is a new feature in Windows Server 2016, offering
users the possibility of taking some of the PCI Express devices in their
systems and pass them through directly to a guest VM.

Currently, the Hyper-V Driver doesn't support PCI device passthrough to VMs.
This blueprint is addressing this issue.

Change-Id: I05b59bca613b024f0a6d41c97658bd63767b9637
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/67/384867/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================== Hyper-V Discrete Device Assignment ================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/hyper-v-discrete-device-assignment Discrete Device Assignment is a new feature in Windows Server 2016, offering users the possibility of taking some of the PCI Express devices in their systems and pass them through directly to a guest VM. Problem description =================== Currently, the Hyper-V Driver doesn't support PCI device passthrough to VMs. This blueprint is addressing this issue. Use Cases ---------- The PCI passthrough feature in OpenStack allows full access and direct control of a physical PCI device in guests. Gain extra performance Project Priority ----------------- None Proposed change =============== To enable PCI passthrough, the following steps are required: 1. Configure nova-scheduler On the controller node add PciPassthroughFilter to scheduler_default_filters to enable PciPassthroughFilter by default. Also ensure that scheduler_available_filters parameter under the [DEFAULT] section in nova.conf is set to all_filters to enable all filters provided by the Compute service. [DEFAULT] scheduler_default_filters = RetryFilter, AvailabilityZoneFilter, RamFilter, ComputeFilter, ComputeCapabilitiesFilter, ImagePropertiesFilter, ServerGroupAntiAffinityFilter, ServerGroupAffinityFilter, PciPassthroughFilter scheduler_available_filters = nova.scheduler.filters.all_filters 2. Configure nova-api Specify a PCI alias for PCI passthrough device requirement in /etc/nova/nova.conf. This allows users to specify the alias in the extra_spec for a flavor, without needing to repeat all the PCI property requirements. Configure a PCI alias a1 to request a PCI device with a vendor_id of 0x8086 and a product_id of 0x154d by adding a list of JSON values which describe the alias in pci_alias config option: [default] pci_alias = { "vendor_id":"8086", "product_id":"154d", "device_type":"type-PF", "name":"a1" } Valid key values are : * "name": Name of the PCI alias. * "product_id": Product ID of the device in hexadecimal. * "vendor_id": Vendor ID of the device in hexadecimal. * "device_type": Type of PCI device. ("type-PCI", "type-PF" or "type-VF") 3. Configure PCI devices in nova-compute Configure nova-compute to allow the PCI device to be passed through to VMs. Add the list of PCI devices available to VMs to pci_passthrough_whitelist option in nova.conf A JSON dictionary will describe a whitelisted PCI device and it must respect the following format: pci_passthrough_whitelist = [{product_id:0001, vendor_id:8086}, {product_id:0002, vendor_id:8086}] 4. Configure a flavor that request pci devices PCI devices can be assigned to guests by specifying the alias of the device and the amount of such devices to be added to VM as flavor extra spec. For users, PCI flavor is a reasonable name like 'oldGPU', 'FastGPU', '10GNIC', 'SSD', describe one kind of PCI device. nova flavor-key pci_flavor set "pci_passthrough:alias"="a1:2" Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- The host system needs to meet the following requirements: 1) the chipset must have: - Interrupt remapping: Intels VT-d with the Interrupt Remapping capability (VT-d2) or any version of AMD I/O Memory Management Unit (I/O MMU). - DMA remapping: Intels VT-d with Queued Invalidations or any AMD I/O MMU. - Access control services (ACS) on PCI Express root ports. - The firmware tables must expose the I/O MMU to the Windows hypervisor. 2) The processor must have either Intels Extended Page Table (EPT) or AMDs Nested Page Table (NPT). The host can be queried for DDA capable devices. [1] A PCI express device that is used for DDA cannot be used by the host and cannot be shared amongst VMs. [2] Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Simona Iuliana Toader <itoader@cloudbasesolutions.com> Work Items ---------- As described in the Proposed Change section. Dependencies ============ Testing ======= * Unit tests. * Feature will be tested by Hyper-V CI. (Tempest tests will have to be added) Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== [1] https://github.com/Microsoft/Virtualization-Documentation [2] Discrete Device Assignment Overview https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/virtualization/2015/11/20/ History =======

commit_message:
Use os-testr instead of testr

This commit switches the use of plain testr for os-testr in the tox
venvs.

Shamelessly copied from I285f820b7de3109665dd7a38da389b7fd42acf80.

commit_message:
Show information of the selected project for create network

Show information of the selected project on create network modal from the
admin/network panel.

The information includes project name, project id, and domain id.

Change-Id: I4448269c637d50cedea733444c27474e0cee365c
Closes-bug: #1600383

commit_message:
Do proper deprecation for security group rule create

Review I03fd0e14e470e7272930ac2651e73263b83bd4e1 renamed the
--src-group and --src-ip options to --remote-group and --remote-ip
but did not properly deprecate the old option names.

Add deprecation warnings when the old option names are used.

Also, format the warnings using the new proposed translation guideline
for marking substrings to not be translated, such as literal names
and option names.

Change-Id: I63d085d190fc28b8637e7686016eda4efbdda1be
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/60/398360/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - | Rename the ``--src-group`` and ``--src-ip`` options in the ``security group rule create`` command to ``--remote-group`` and ``--remote-ip``. The ``--src-group`` and ``--src-ip`` options are deprecated but still supported, and will be removed in a future release.
deleted_lines: - Changed the ``security group rule create`` command ``--src-ip`` option to ``--remote-ip``, ``--src-group`` option to ``--remote-group``. Using the ``--src-ip`` ``--src-group`` option is still supported, but is no longer documented and may be deprecated in a future release.

commit_message:
LinuxBridge: Pass host into get_devices_details_list

Pass the host into get_devices_details_list on the linux bridge
agent so the debug logs on the server side don't show "host None".
This is mainly just for cosmetics and consistency with the OVS agent
since the only thing the host is really used for on the server side
is special treatment of DVR ports, which does not currently apply
to linux bridge.

Change-Id: I700fa26982bdb087cf7ea4b3eb69aec2f2e099c8
Closes-Bug: #1622566
(cherry picked from commit 2fe2efc55db4cffe90dd284cb074de81e0efbd4e)

commit_message:
Avoid trace in _notify_l3_agent_ha_port_update

Backport [1] is causing trace in _notify_l3_agent_ha_port_update.
This callback is invoked for each port's AFTER_UPDATE event, but
initial port updates(for example, port binding) won't have
allowed_address_pairs as part of port DB.
With this change, _notify_l3_agent_ha_port_update will only process
port if the event is from update_device_up i.e after port is
completely configured.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/364407/
Closes-Bug: #1640701

Change-Id: If8aa47d154f229e5597e43efd402bcadb7db03ac
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/20/396520/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if not kwargs.get('update_device_up'): return

commit_message:
Increase haproxy timeouts

It's been proposed this may help with the
('Connection aborted.', BadStatusLine("''",)) errors.

This patch increase queue, server and client timeouts to 2m (default is 1m)
Related-Bug: #1638908

Change-Id: Ie4f059f3fad2271bb472697e85ede296eee91f5d
(cherry picked from commit 1bee7bc8fa0ca5ace330e54bc3e64d7f6692d5a7)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/22/397822/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Defaults to [ 'http-request 10s', 'queue 2m', 'connect 10s', 'client 2m', 'server 2m', 'check 10s' ] $haproxy_default_timeout = [ 'http-request 10s', 'queue 2m', 'connect 10s', 'client 2m', 'server 2m', 'check 10s' ]

commit_message:
Return 409 if removing/replacing image locations.

urrently image location updates (removing, replacing) are permitted for
images even if their state is not ``active``.
This lite-spec describes the need to prevent removal of image
locations of images that are not in ``active`` state and the replacement of
image locations of images that are not in ``active`` or ``queued`` state by
returning a Conflict Error (409 response code).

Change-Id: I8e8bdbd95baca8586afc68e56c984b6adc4ca591
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance-specs refs/changes/50/388950/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Return 409 if removing/replacing the location of an image that's not ``active`` ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- :problem: When ``show_multiple_locations`` is set to ``True``, users currently can remove or replace locations of an image irrespective of the image status. This can result in bad experiences for the users:- 1) If one tries to change or remove the location for an image while it is in ``saving`` state, Glance would be trying to write data to a previously saved location while the user updates the custom location. This results in a race condition. 2) For images that are in ``queued`` state and no image data has been uploaded yet, there is no need for an image location to be removed and permitting users to remove the image location can result in a bad experience. However users can be allowed to replace the image location to maintain backward compatibility and also because replacing could mean replacing an empty location by a non-empty image location. 3) For images in ``deactivated`` state, it is essential that image locations are not updated as it does not abide with the purpose of the image state being set to ``deactivated`` and may cause security concerns. :solution: Return Conflict Error (409 response code) if an attempt to remove or replace the image location is made when the status of the image is anything but ``active``. :impacts: A Conflict Error will be thrown preventing users from replacing or removing locations to images when the image status is not ``active``. :timeline: Expected to be merged within the newton-rc time frame. :link: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/366995/ :assignee: Nikhil Komawar, Dharini Chandrasekar Return 409 if removing/replacing the location of an image that's not ``active`` +++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

commit_message:
Adds NFS secure/unsecure options

This commit adds the ability to configure the testing host to run in secury
mode. If specified in by the NFS_SECURE_FILE_OPERATIONS option, the NFS server
and Cinder NFS driver will be configured to run in secure mode.

Change-Id: Ibaa91774b7ac19b39aa4ed7b4792c4f77a4d20f2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-plugin-nfs refs/changes/16/369516/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LIBVIRT_SERVICE=libvirt-bin LIBVIRT_SERVICE=libvirtdfunction configure_libvirt { QEMU_CONF=/etc/libvirt/qemu.conf cat <<EOF | sudo tee -a ${QEMU_CONF} user = 'ubuntu' group = 'ubuntu' EOF sudo service ${LIBVIRT_SERVICE} restart } function configure_apparmor { if is_package_installed apparmor; then NFS_APPARMOR_PROFILE=/etc/apparmor.d/libvirt/nfs-snapshots.files QEMU_APPARMOR_TPL=/etc/apparmor.d/libvirt/TEMPLATE.qemu cat <<EOF | sudo tee -a ${NFS_APPARMOR_PROFILE} "${NOVA_STATE_PATH}/mnt/**/*" rw, EOF cat << EOF | sudo tee ${QEMU_APPARMOR_TPL} #include <tunables/global> profile LIBVIRT_TEMPLATE { #include <abstractions/libvirt-qemu> #include <libvirt/nfs-snapshots.files> } EOF sudo service ${LIBVIRT_SERVICE} restart sudo service apparmor restart fi } if [[ ${NFS_SECURE_FILE_OPERATIONS} == True ]]; then ROOT_SQUASH=root_squash else ROOT_SQUASH=no_root_squash fi $NFS_EXPORT_DIR localhost(rw,${ROOT_SQUASH}) if [[ ${NFS_SECURE_FILE_OPERATIONS} == True ]]; then echo_summary "NAS Securyty is ON" echo_summary "Configuring Libvirt" configure_libvirt fi if is_ubuntu; then echo_summary "Configuring Apparmor" configure_apparmor fi

commit_message:
Implemented audit.update notification

In this changeset, I implemented the sending of update notifications
whenever an audit is modified.

Change-Id: I5ccc2516ce896ae7d4ef542b133e8f052eaed602
Partially-Implements: blueprint audit-versioned-notifications-api

A context should be set when instantiating the object, e.g.: Audit(context) def soft_delete(self, context=None): """soft Delete the Audit from the DB. :param context: Security context. commit_message:
Update devstack plugin to add notification param

In this changeset, I updated the devstack plugin so it has the
necessary configuration options for it to emit the Watcher
notifications straight out of the box.

Partially Implements: blueprint watcher-notifications-ovo

Change-Id: I048e0b82cde40bd3699c90429bdf55ee235fff3b
